Text: Rudolf Höss (also Höß, Hoeß or Hoess; 25 November 1901 – 16 April 1947) was a Nazi German "SS"-"Obersturmbannführer" (lieutenant colonel) and the longest-serving commandant of Auschwitz concentration and extermination camp in World War II.

*Rudolf Höss
2:
--------------------
<Text3: Rudolf Höss:  On the initiative of one of his subordinates, SS-"Hauptsturmführer" (captain) Karl Fritzsch, Höss introduced pesticide Zyklon B containing hydrogen cyanide to the killing process, thereby allowing SS soldiers at Auschwitz to murder 2,000 people every hour.>
Triplets:<Rudolf Höss
3:
--------------------
Text: Rudolf Höss:  He created the largest installation for the continuous annihilation of human beings ever known.
